description.narrative: Oxfam in Uganda will implement the Right to food project under a one country program arrangement; The Country Office will provide support to partners in line with the Oxfam County Strategy (OCS) priority areas of the greater northern Uganda Region. Oxfam in Uganda shall continuously seek on behalf of her partners support from The Hague to implement the project. The Country Office will be a contractor and will retain some resources to engage directly in the implementation of the project by setting agenda, co-creation, building capacity of partners and developing position papers to present to duty bearers both from the public and private sectors. The country office will also maintain strategic lead in coordinating partners# activities, harmonizing partners# work plans, establishingand maintaining positive relations amongst partners, taking overall lead <(>&<)> guidance in knowledge generation, conducting researches and sharing learning to engage policy makers and duty bearers to change policies and practices.This strategic lead will be both at local, national, regional and global levels for effective realization of the smallholders food producers# (especially women) right to food. The country office will further ensure through capacity building, mentorship, monitoring and learning that partners# properly document practices, challenges, models and evidences to be used in making policy propositions. The country office will also implement a few activities mainly the ones under strengthen capacity and improve policies of private and government actors directly and with partners. In some engagements, Oxfam in Uganda will use counterparts information to quantity her achievements e.g. in increase citizens' voices because of the direct connect counterparts have with the grassroots. The country office will be responsible for the aggregation of results of partners and reflect the overall project achievements/progress.

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam Novib is one of the 17 national affiliates of the Oxfam International Confederation. It started life in 1956 as the Netherlands Organisation for International Assistance (Novib), and joined forces with Oxfam in 1994. Working together in confederation, the Oxfam affiliates can speak with one clear and compelling voice on issues of global concern: climate change, health and education forall, agriculture, trade, and conflicts and emergencies. Oxfam established this country office to support local organizations and projects. Through this local office Oxfam Novib directly contributes towards this project’s implementation.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to a sustainable livelihood
The right to social and political participation
